value.title: 3 ways Reporting Services and Power BI work together
value.excerpt: With the release of Microsoft SQL Server 2016, I look at how Reporting Services and Power BI work together. From the Power BI mobile app, to pinning visualizations to a dashboard and how Reporting Services handles Power BI Desktop files.  #PowerBI #SSRS  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: 3 ways to try Power BI
value.excerpt: Are you wanting to try Power BI, but not sure where to start? I look at some ways you can get up and running with Power BI quickly. value.title: Avoid Left Outer Joins with DirectQuery in Power BI
value.excerpt: By default, your DirectQuery queries, in Power BI, will send a LEFT OUTER JOIN and could make your DBA not happy! Patrick shows you how you can change this to an INNER JOIN and put your DBA back into that happy space.  游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want

value.excerpt: I walk through how to configure Kerberos to get Power BI reports within SQL Server Reporting Services running in a distributed environment. value.title: Connect from Power BI Mobile to SSRS using OAuth
value.excerpt: Connect from Power BI Mobile to SSRS using OAuth  In this video, I show you how to configure Active Directory Federated Services (ADFS) and the Web Application Proxy (WAP) role, in Windows 2016, so that you can connect from Power BI mobile to SQL Server Reporting Services using OAuth. value.title: Copy Conditional Columns in Power Query or Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how to use conditional columns within Power Query and then copying them for use in other queries or Power BI Desktop files. This is a great technique if you don't want to retype all of the conditional items in the dialog in Power BI.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com
